Screen.title: TopScreen
Screen.Label: ---------- Mouse Button 1 click on field to change ----------

Help.Tip: Menu allowing user choice of stored parameter defaults.
Help.Text:
modmo2d - PROCESSDEFAULTS
Menu allowing user choice of stored parameter defaults.
 
 Default = SYSTEM
 Allowed = SYSTEM
 Allowed = PROJECT
 Allowed = USER
 SYSTEM defaults are the defaults listed in the CPS documentation.
 
 PROJECT defaults are defaults the user has saved via the Save as Project
 Default button.
 
 USER defaults are defaults the user has saved via the Save as User Default
 button.

modmo2d - ANI_TYPE
Type of anisotropy.
 
 Default = ISOTROPIC
 Allowed = VTI, ISOTROPIC

Help.Tip: Choose VP0_FILE using a file selection dialog box.
Help.Text:
modmo2d - SELECT_VP0_FILE
Choose VP0_FILE using a file selection dialog box.

Help.Tip: Pathname for input vertical P-wave velocity dataset.
Help.Text:
modmo2d - VP0_FILE
Pathname for input vertical P-wave velocity dataset.
 
 Default = NONE
 Allowed = char

modmo2d - VP0_FILE_INFO
Status of VP0_FILE.

modmo2d - CONSTANT_VS_VP
Constant Vs/Vp ratio.
 
 Default = NO
 Allowed = YES, NO

modmo2d - VS_VP_RATIO
Constant Vs/Vp ratio value.
 
 Default = 0.5
 Allowed = real scalar

Help.Tip: Choose VS0_FILE using a file selection dialog box.
Help.Text:
modmo2d - SELECT_VS0_FILE
Choose VS0_FILE using a file selection dialog box.

Help.Tip: Pathname for input vertical S-wave velocity dataset.
Help.Text:
modmo2d - VS0_FILE
Pathname for input vertical S-wave velocity dataset.
 
 Default = NONE
 Allowed = char

modmo2d - VS0_FILE_INFO
Status of VS0_FILE.

Help.Tip: Choose EPS_FILE using a file selection dialog box.
Help.Text:
modmo2d - SELECT_EPS_FILE
Choose EPS_FILE using a file selection dialog box.

Help.Tip: Pathname for input epsilon parameter dataset.
Help.Text:
modmo2d - EPS_FILE
Pathname for input epsilon parameter dataset.
 
 Default = NONE
 Allowed = char

modmo2d - EPS_FILE_INFO
Status of EPS_FILE.

Help.Tip: Choose DEL_FILE using a file selection dialog box.
Help.Text:
modmo2d - SELECT_DEL_FILE
Choose DEL_FILE using a file selection dialog box.

Help.Tip: Pathname for input delta parameter dataset.
Help.Text:
modmo2d - DEL_FILE
Pathname for input delta parameter dataset.
 
 Default = NONE
 Allowed = char

modmo2d - DEL_FILE_INFO
Status of DEL_FILE.

modmo2d - TIME2DEPTH
Direction of transform.
 
 Default = TIME2DEPTH
 Allowed = DEPTH2TIME, TIME2DEPTH
 TIME2DEPTH converts from time to depth.
 DEPTH2TIME converts from depth to time.

modmo2d - SINGLE_VZ
Single velocity trace.
 
 Default = NO
 Allowed = YES, NO

modmo2d - NZ
Number of z samples.
 
 Default = 1000
 Allowed = int>=1
 If input is depth data, NZ is taken from the input trace data.

modmo2d - NT
Number of time samples.
 
 Default = 1000
 Allowed = int>=1
 If input is time data, NT is taken from the input trace data.

Help.Tip: Number of z samples for model.
Help.Text:
modmo2d - NZM
Number of z samples for model.
 
 Default = NZ
 Allowed = int>=1
 Does not need to match input velocity model, but does need to fall within
 the input velocity model.

modmo2d - DZ
Depth increment.
 
 Default = 5.0
 Allowed = real scalar
 If input is depth data, DZ is taken from the input trace data.

modmo2d - DELT
Time increment.
 
 Default = 0.004
 Allowed = real scalar
 If input is time data, DELT is taken from the input trace data.

modmo2d - DZM
Depth increment for model.
 
 Default = DZ
 Allowed = real scalar
 Does not need to match input velocity model, but does need to fall within
 the input velocity model.

modmo2d - Z0
Starting depth.
 
 Default = 0.0
 Allowed = real scalar
 If input is depth data, Z0 is taken from the input trace data.

modmo2d - T0
Starting time.
 
 Default = 0.0
 Allowed = real scalar
 If input is time data, T0 is taken from the input trace data.

modmo2d - Z0M
Starting depth for model.
 
 Default = Z0
 Allowed = real scalar
 Does not need to match input velocity model, but does need to fall within
 the input velocity model.

modmo2d - DEPTH_SCALE
Scale factor for depth axis.
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = real scalar > 0.0
 For input depth data,
   DZ = DT    * DEPTH_SCALE
   Z0 = TSTRT * DEPTH_SCALE
 For output depth data,
   DT    = DZ / DEPTH_SCALE
   TSTRT = Z0 / DEPTH_SCALE
 DZM and Z0M are not affected by this parameter.

modmo2d - OFFMAX
Maximum offset.
 
 Default = 4000.
 Allowed = real scalar

modmo2d - DXMAP
Transverse sampling in a ttmap.
 
 Default = 5.0
 Allowed = real scalar

Help.Tip: Number of times to smooth the velocity model.
Help.Text:
modmo2d - ISMOO
Number of times to smooth the velocity model.
 
 Default = 5
 Allowed = int>=0

modmo2d - ANG
Maximum emergence angle.
 
 Default = 89.9
 Allowed = real scalar
 Specified in degrees.

modmo2d - DANG
Angle increment.
 
 Default = 0.5
 Allowed = real scalar
 Specified in degrees.

Help.Tip: Header word to use for in-line coordinate or grid value.
Help.Text:
modmo2d - ILINEHDR
Header word to use for in-line coordinate or grid value.
 
 Default = 7
 Allowed = valid CPS header word
 This needs to match input data.

modmo2d - ACQ_AZIMUTH
Dominant acquisition azimuth.
 
 Default = ILINE
 Allowed = ILINE or XLINE
 2-D raytracing will be performed in velocity profiles parallel to the
 dominant acquisition azimuth.

Help.Tip: Header word to use for cross-line coordinate or grid value.
Help.Text:
modmo2d - XLINEHDR
Header word to use for cross-line coordinate or grid value.
 
 Default = 8
 Allowed = valid CPS header word
 This needs to match input data.

modmo2d - GRID_WIDTH_TYPE
Grid width type.
 
 Default = USER_DEFINED
 Allowed = X_GRID_DISTANCE, Y_GRID_DISTANCE, USER_DEFINED
 The grid width specifies the real-world distance between adjacent grid
 numbers for the dominant acquisition azimuth.  If the geometry is set
 correctly in PROJECT_DATA, grid width should be equal to either
 X_GRID_DISTANCE or Y_GRID_DISTANCE.  Otherwise, USER_DEFINED should be
 selected and the correct value entered for GRID_WIDTH_USER.

modmo2d - IVERBOS
Verbose logging.
 
 Default = 0
 Allowed = 0,1

modmo2d - GRID_WIDTH_USER
User-defined grid width.
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed = real scalar > 0.
 Specify the real-world distance between adjacent grid numbers for the
 dominant acquisition azimuth; i.e. grid width = real-world distance between
 grid point i and grid point i+1.

modmo2d - DUMP_VEL
Dump velocities.
 
 Default = NO
 Allowed = YES, NO
 Dump velocities used for each gather location to disk.  See VP0_DUMPFILE for
 more information.

Help.Tip: Choose VP0_DUMPFILE using a file selection dialog box.
Help.Text:
modmo2d - SELECT_VP0_DUMPFILE
Choose VP0_DUMPFILE using a file selection dialog box.

Help.Tip: Pathname for output vertical P-wave velocities used for each gather locati
Help.Text:
modmo2d - VP0_DUMPFILE
Pathname for output vertical P-wave velocities used for each gather locati
 
 Default = NONE
 Allowed = char
 Pathname for output vertical P-wave velocities used for each gather location.
 For parallel jobs, the filename is modified by appending ".peXXXX", where
 XXXX is the worker number.  The output format is CPS TRCIO.  The header words
 for each output velocity trace are identical to the first trace in each
 gather.  For parallel jobs, this should allow the velocity traces to be
 sorted to the correct order.

modmo2d - VP0_DUMPFILE_INFO
Status of VP0_DUMPFILE.

Help.Tip: Button that removes this process parameter screen.
Help.Text:
modmo2d - CLOSE
Button that removes this process parameter screen.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Appears only on the view-only process parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button to accept parameter values, run traps and remove screen.
Help.Text:
modmo2d - OK
Button to accept parameter values, run traps and remove screen.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that accepts parameter values, runs the parameter traps and removes
 the parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps.
Help.Text:
modmo2d - APPLY
Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps but does
 not remove the parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button to remove the parameter screen without changing parameters.
Help.Text:
modmo2d - CANCEL
Button to remove the parameter screen without changing parameters.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =

Help.Tip: Set parameters to their initial value or last applied value.
Help.Text:
modmo2d - RESET
Set parameters to their initial value or last applied value.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that sets the parameters back to their values when the screen appeared
 or to their last applied value.

Help.Tip: Accept the current parameters and move to the previous process.
Help.Text:
modmo2d - PROCESSLISTLEFT
Accept the current parameters and move to the previous process.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to the previous process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Menu of processes in the current workfile and their number.
Help.Text:
modmo2d - PROCESSLIST
Menu of processes in the current workfile and their number.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Menu that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to any chosen process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Accept the current parameters and move to the next process.
Help.Text:
modmo2d - PROCESSLISTRIGHT
Accept the current parameters and move to the next process.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to the next process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Save the current parameter values as Project Defaults.
Help.Text:
modmo2d - PROJECTDEFAULT
Save the current parameter values as Project Defaults.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that saves the current parameter values as Project Defaults for this
 process.  There will be one set of Project Defaults for a project.

Help.Tip: Save the current parameter values as User Defaults.
Help.Text:
modmo2d - USERDEFAULT
Save the current parameter values as User Defaults.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that saves the current parameter values as User Defaults for this
 process.  There will be one set of User Defaults for a userid.

Help.Tip: Allows the user to access the pop-up Help Window.
Help.Text:
modmo2d - HELP
Allows the user to access the pop-up Help Window.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 The Help Window allows access to three kinds of help:  Parameter Help, CPS
 Process Help and Application (CFE) Help.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                         C P S   P R O C E S S
 
 Name       : MODMO2D
 Category   : Transforms
 Written    : 2004-07-27   by: bkmacy
 Revised    : 2006-10-16   by: D. Glover
 Maturity   : production
 Purpose    : Time to depth 2-D model-based moveout.
 Portability: No known limitations.
 Parallel   : Yes.
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                          GENERAL DESCRIPTION
 
 MODMO2D converts time-domain common image gathers with moveout to the
 depth domain using model-based moveout.  Alternatively, depth-domain
 gathers without moveout can be converted to the time domain with
 moveout.  The model-based approach uses a 2-D velocity model with the
 velocity model profile parallel to the dominant acquisition azimuth.
 The input velocity model is either isotropic or transversely isotropic
 with a vertical symmetry axis (VTI).  The following velocity parameters
 are required:
 
 ISOTROPIC:     vertical P-wave velocity
 VTI:           vertical P-wave velocity, vertical S-wave velocity, delta,
                and epsilon.
 
 This process is based on the FreeUSP-style programs GATHERT2Z_ANI and
 GATHERZ2T_ANI written by Dan Whitmore.
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                          ADVICE FOR USERS
 
 The grid transformation must be set up in the project data if the velocity
 model is specified in grid coordinates rather than survey coordinates.
 Otherwise, the velocity model will not be scaled correctly laterally.
 Alternatively, the user can specify the real-world distance between adjacent
 grid numbers for the dominant acquisition azimuth.  See the GRID_WIDTH_TYPE
 and GRID_WIDTH_USER parameters for more details.
 
 To scale the depth axis appropriately, use the DEPTH_SCALE option.  For input
 depth traces, the sampling interval (DT) and starting depth (TSTRT) are
 multiplied by DEPTH_SCALE to determine DZ and Z0; i.e.,
 
 DZ = DT    * DEPTH_SCALE
 Z0 = TSTRT * DEPTH_SCALE
 
 For output depth traces, the sampling interval (DZ) and starting depth (Z0)
 are divided by DEPTH_SCALE to determine DT and TSTRT; i.e.,
 
 DT    = DZ / DEPTH_SCALE
 TSTRT = Z0 / DEPTH_SCALE
 
 If the true depth scale should be in feet or meters, but the input or
 output depth traces should have a sample interval of kilofeet or
 kilometers, set DEPTH_SCALE=1000.  For example, if the true depth sample
 interval is 30 feet, but the input depth sample interval is 0.03 (as
 specified by DT in JOB DATA), then set DEPTH_SCALE=1000.
 
 The DEPTH_SCALE option does not affect the "model" depth parameters (DZM and
 Z0M).  Set the model depth parameters to the same scale as DZ and Z0, not to
 DT and TSTRT.
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                             REVISION HISTORY
 
     Date        Author     Description
     ----        ------     -----------
004. 2006-10-16  D. Glover  Added NULLIFY statements for Intel compiler.
003. 2006-01-10  B. Menger  Removed Unused Variables.
  2. 2005-01-31  bkmacy     Added ability for user to explicitly specify the
                              grid width for the dominant acquisition azimuth
                              (see GRID_WIDTH_TYPE and GRID_WIDTH_USER
                              parameters.)
                            Changed DUMP_VEL flag to be YES or NO instead of 1
                              or 0, and to allow the user to specify the name
                              of the output file (VP0_DUMPFILE).
                            Expanded the use of timer routines and reporting.
  1. 2004-07-27  bkmacy     Initial version.  Based on CPS revision 13 of
                            modmo.f90.
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
